intro: Primula sinensis alba-plena-grandiflora, commonly known as the Chinese primrose, is a hybrid species characterized by its dense, double flowers. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is native to China. The plant features showy, white petals that are often adorned with a pale pink or cream center. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and prefers cool, moist environments. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and as a potted plant.
